intro: Paederia petrophila, commonly known as the rock paederia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, often growing in rocky or limestone habitats. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a rough texture. Paederia petrophila is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils, making it a common species in mountainous and coastal areas.
